question: Which layout best guides executives from overview to detail?
options: KPI scorecards on top, trend visuals in the middle, diagnostic tables at the bottom
Random chart ordering on every refresh
All raw tables first, then KPIs
Dense scatter plots in every quadrant
explanation: Leading with KPIs frames the story, and deeper visuals support the takeaway.

question: You already show monthly revenue by region. What should you do before adding another revenue chart?
options: Confirm the new chart delivers a different insight or consolidate the view
Duplicate the existing chart for symmetry
Hide the KPI tiles
Change palettes without reviewing content
explanation: Dashboards should avoid redundancy; each tile must add new signal.

question: How can you highlight that SupportTickets fell below 1,200 in September on a dashboard?
options: Add an annotation or reference band to the trend chart
Remove axis labels so the drop is surprising
Switch the chart to 3D
Export the data and delete the visual
explanation: Annotations make the milestone explicit and tie it to the story.

question: Why reuse a consistent color palette and typography across panels?
options: It reduces cognitive load and keeps focus on the insights
It automatically governs permissions
It forces every chart to look identical
It is required for export to CSV
explanation: Consistency keeps attention on the message instead of theme changes.

question: When should you embed explanatory text or call-to-action notes?
options: Whenever a viewer needs guidance on how to respond to the data
Only when the dashboard has fewer than three charts
Never—text distracts from visuals
Only after exporting to PDF
explanation: Contextual notes help stakeholders turn observations into decisions.

question: How often should you schedule dashboard maintenance reviews?
options: On a regular cadence (e.g., monthly or quarterly) to retire stale panels
Only when a stakeholder complains
Never—dashboards are static
Every day regardless of usage
explanation: Routine reviews ensure data sources stay fresh and visuals remain relevant.

question: What is the best way to enable teams to explore details without cluttering the main view?
options: Use filters, drill-down actions, or linked tabs rather than duplicating charts
Copy the entire dashboard for each persona
Hide all filters permanently
Add every possible field to every tooltip
explanation: Interactive controls keep the primary story focused while offering depth on demand.
